intro: Ruellia antiquorum, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody at the base. Ruellia antiquorum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
